title: Authentication & Authorization
subject: MongoDB
theory: MongoDB uses Role-Based Access Control (RBAC). You create users and assign them roles (e.g., read, readWrite, dbAdmin) on specific databases.

examples.explanation: This user can now create other users.

common_mistakes.correction: Authentication is DB-scoped. If you create 'bob' in 'test', he must authenticate against 'test'.

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between specific roles and built-in roles?
interview_questions.answer: Built-in roles (read, readWrite) cover common cases. You can define custom roles for fine-grained privileges.

real_world_use_cases.description: Each microservice has its own DB user restricted only to its specific database.

summary: RBAC ensures the principle of least privilege is applied.
